alert.note: Alert for Augusta; Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge; Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 9:52AM EST until January 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulation ranging from a coating to an inch near and south of Interstate 64, with 2 to 4 inches across the northern Shenandoah Valley, northern Virginia Blue Ridge Mountains, western Maryland, and eastern West Virginia. Northwest winds gusting around 25 to 35 mph this afternoon into this evening. * WHERE...Portions of north central and western Maryland, central, northwest and western Virginia and eastern and panhandle West Virginia. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Augusta; Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge; Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah
